oracle.mapviewer.share.ext
Interface NSDataProvider

public interface NSDataProvider

This interface defines a generic Non-Spatial data provider. An NSDataProvider provides the interface through which application can write a custom non-spatial data provider. The attribute data produced by such a data provider can be joined with any theme to facilitate truely dynamic thematic mapping.
In addition to implementing all the defined public methods, your impelmentation must also add a do-nothing constructor (without any parameter).
An NSDataProvider implementation must be registered with MapViewer by adding an entry in the mapViewerConfig.xml file. MapViewer automatically creates a single instance of this implementation, register it in its internal list, and then calls its init method to perform all necessary initialization.
After registration is complete, application can issue map requests that contain a non-spatial data provider which refernces this implementation. MapViewer will automatically call the buildDataSet method on the registered implementation, and join the non-spatial attribute data it prodocues with the theme referenced in the tag.

Method Summary
 NSDataSet buildDataSet(java.util.Hashtable params)
          This method creates and returns an instance of NSDataSet which contains all the Non-Spatial attribute data produced by this provider, based on the given parameters for a specific incoming map request.
 void destroy()
          This method is called when this provider is about to be destroyed.
 boolean init(java.util.Properties params)
          This method should implement all necessary one-time intializations.
 

Method Detail

init

boolean init(java.util.Properties params)
This method should implement all necessary one-time intializations. The properties passed to this method are obtained by MapViewer when loading the mapViewerConfig.xml file and registering this implementation.
MapViewer will all this method only once per lifecycle of the MapViewer instance.

Parameters:
parameters - to be used by the initialization method.
Returns:
true if success; false otherwise

buildDataSet

NSDataSet buildDataSet(java.util.Hashtable params)
This method creates and returns an instance of NSDataSet which contains all the Non-Spatial attribute data produced by this provider, based on the given parameters for a specific incoming map request.
Unlike the properties passed into the init() method which are global ones, the parameters here are specific to one map request.
Note that starting with 11g, the params has changed from a Properties class to the Hashtable class. This change enables MapViewer to pass two context objects: HttpServletRequest and HttpSession (if one exists) to your implementation. These two objects are accessed through the key "mv-oms-request" and "mv-http-session" respectively. All other NSDP parameters embedded in a map request can still be accessed from the params object using the same key by calling the get(key) method of the hashtable. You may however need to cast the return object into String type for these regular NSDP parameters.
MapViewer calls this method when processing any map request that contains a Non-spatial data provider tag that refrences this implementation. As such this method needs to be reentrant.

Parameters:
params - to be used when creating a data set.
Returns:
an instance of NSDataSet; null if failed.

destroy

void destroy()
This method is called when this provider is about to be destroyed.
